title: Greece Awards Offshore Exploration Blocks to Chevron
summary: Greece on Friday announced it is awarding four offshore oil and gas exploration blocks to a Chevron-led consortium. Following evaluations and negotiations with Chevron, the joint venture Chevron Greece Holdings – Helleniq Upstream was picked as the selected applicant in the Greek exploration tender…

title: Global LNG Exports Hit a Record High in September
summary: Exports of liquefied natural gas globally increased to 34.59 million tons last month, which was the highest on record, the Gas Exporting Countries Forum reported. The increase was driven by a boost in imports, at an annual 3.7%, which in turn was driven by a surge in demand in the European Union. T…

title: LNG Demand Fuels Strong Third Quarter for Baker Hughes
summary: Strong demand for LNG-related services drove Baker Hughes' third-quarter financial performance above expectations, with the company reporting a 23% annual increase in orders despite a dip in net profits of 20% on the year. Free cash flow rose as well, from $239 million at the end of June to $699 mi…

title: Germany races to secure US sanctions exemption for Rosneft refineries
summary: Berlin says Washington should not target subsidiaries of Russian oil company located in Germany

title: Why the Permian Basin is facing a power crunch
summary: There’s not enough electricity to go around, particularly as oil production has soared
